means: 澄清（某人/某事物）受到的责难或嫌疑( vindicate的过去式和过去分词 )
表明或证明（所争辩的事物）属实、正当、有效等

sentence.Network_en: The director said he had been vindicated by the experts' report.
sentence.Network_cn: 主任说专家们的报告证明了他是正确的。

sentence.Network_en: He was vindicated in court and damages were awarded.
sentence.Network_cn: 他在法庭上被证明无罪，并且获得了损害赔偿金。

sentence.Network_en: I have every confidence that this decision will be fully vindicated.
sentence.Network_cn: 我完全相信这一决定的正确性将得到充分证明。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 王艺蓁看过的单字 - Voicetube - 看影片学英语 ... deteriorated 恶化 vindicated 平反 mounted (a.)安在马上的,裱好的.
Doping is a major problem in sport ... FBI 美国联邦调查局 vindicated 无罪释放 controversial treatments 引起争议的治疗方法.
vindicate 为辩护, vindicated 捍卫, vindicate 证明正确
Her claim to the title was vindicated by historians ., 她说她有权得到这一头衔 , 历史学家证明此事属实.

list.abs: Has anyone vindicated the forest the dead man ' s nephew ?, 有没有人为死者的侄儿要求那片森林的所有权呢?

based on the restructuring of Yunnan Salt Chemical Co . , Ltd , this paper approaches how the Union performs its vindication function in the process of enterprise restructuring .针对云南盐化股份公司的改制情况，探讨在国企改制的过程中，工会如何履行好维护职能作用。
how would you vindicate your failure to your family ?你将如何向你家人解释你的失败？
不，审判的日子是上帝事先决定的公开审判（public vindication）。祂已经知道谁是属于祂的。

entry.tran: 证实;证明…正确;证明…无辜
entry.def: If a person or their decisions, actions, or ideas are vindicated, they are proved to be correct, after people have said that they were wrong.

example.ex: The director said he had been vindicated by the experts' report...
example.tran: 主任说专家们的报告证明了他是正确的。

example.ex: Ministers and officials are confident their decision will be vindicated.
example.tran: 部长们和官员们相信他们的决定会被证明是正确的。

means.word_mean: 1. freed from any question of guilt;

sentences.sentence: "was now clear of the charge of cowardice"

auth_sentence.content: This decision has been abundantly vindicated by the results.

auth_sentence.content: Strange how these prophets long to be vindicated too.

auth_sentence.content: If the place succeeds, we'll be vindicated.
